org.svvrl.goal.cmd
Class CmdUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.cmd.CmdUtil

public class CmdUtil
extends java.lang.Object

CmdUtil provides utility methods for the command-line package.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

castOrLoadEditable

public static Editable castOrLoadEditable(java.lang.Object obj)
                                   throws EvaluationException
Tries to converts a specified object to an editable object. If the object is an editable object, cast it as an editable object. Otherwise, view the object as a file name and try to read an editable object from that file.

Parameters:
obj - an object to be converted
Returns:
an editable object retrieved from obj
Throws:
EvaluationException - if no editable object can be retrieved from obj

                                     throws EvaluationException
Tries to converts a specified object to an automaton.

Parameters:
obj - an object to be converted
Returns:
an automaton converted from obj
Throws:
EvaluationException - if obj does not represent an automaton

castAsCollection

public static java.util.Collection<?> castAsCollection(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns a collection represented by a specified object. If the object is already a collection, simply cast it. Otherwise, treat the string representation of the object as a comma-separated array.

Parameters:
obj - an object
Returns:
a collection represented by the object

castAsMap

public static java.util.Map<?,?> castAsMap(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns a map represented by a specified object. If the object is already a map, simply cast it. Otherwise, treat the string representation of the object as a comma-separated entries.

Parameters:
obj - an object
Returns:
a map represented by the object

echo

public static java.lang.String echo(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns a string representation of an object. If the object is a collection, a map, or an array, the glue between the elements will be newline.

Parameters:
obj - an object
Returns:
the string representation of obj

echo

public static java.lang.String echo(java.lang.Object obj,
                                    java.lang.String glue)
Returns a string representation of an object.

Parameters:
obj - an object
glue - the glue between elements of the object if the object is a collection, a map, or an array
Returns:
the string representation of obj
